relation: This command was integrated into Cisco IOS Release 12.2(33)SXJ.
This command was integrated into Cisco IOS XE Release 3.3S.
This command was integrated into Cisco IOS Release 15.1(4)M.
This command was integrated into Cisco IOS Release 15.2(1)S.
pageTitle: Cisco IOS Basic System Management Command Reference - N through T Commands [Support] - Cisco

To prevent the router from accepting broadcast traffic, use the no form of this command., 313560=Many lower-end routers (for example, the Cisco 2500 series or the Cisco 2600 series) do not have hardware clocks, so this command is not available on those platforms., 438443=Configures a Cisco 1003, Cisco 1004, Cisco 1005, Cisco 1600, Cisco 1720, or Cisco 1750 router to use SNTP to request and accept NTP traffic from a time server., 470535=Configures a Cisco 1003, Cisco 1004, Cisco 1005, Cisco 1600, Cisco 1720, or Cisco 1750 router to use SNTP to accept NTP traffic from any broadcast server., 430216=To show information about the Simple Network Time Protocol (SNTP), use the show sntpcommand in EXEC mode on a Cisco 1003, Cisco 1004, Cisco 1005, Cisco 1600, Cisco 1720, or Cisco 1750 router., 232205=The following example shows how to configure a router to allow its software clock to be synchronized with the software clock of a peer (or vice versa) at the IPv4 address 192.168.22.33 using NTPv2. textBeforeTable: Syntax Description { peer | query-only | serve | serve-only } [ ipv4 | ipv6 ] access-group ntp no [ kod ] { access-list-number | access-list-number-expanded | access-list-name } { peer | query-only | serve | serve-only } [ ipv4 | ipv6 ] access-group ntp To control access to Network Time Protocol (NTP) services on the system, use the ntp access-group command in global configuration mode. To remove access control to the NTP services, use the no form of this command. ntp access-group time-range time-period sntp source-interface sntp server sntp logging sntp broadcast client show time-range show sntp show ntp status show ntp packets show ntp info show ntp associations show clock show calendar show buffers usage show buffers tune show buffers leak ntp update-calendar ntp trusted-key ntp source ntp server ntp refclock ntp peer ntp passive ntp panic update ntp
textAfterTable: Note    You must configure the ntp server ip-address command before using the serve-only keyword. access-list-number Number (from 1 to 99) of a standard IPv4 or IPv6 access list. access-list-number-expanded Number (from 1300 to 1999) of an expanded range IPv4 or IPv6 access list. access-list-name Name of an access list. kod (Optional) Sends the “Kiss-of-Death” (KOD) packet to any host that tries to send a packet that is not compliant with the access-group policy. Command Default By default, there is no access control. Full access is granted to all systems. Command Modes Global configuration (config) Command History Release Modification
